medical_history.chief_complaint: increasingly less responsive to IV immunoglobulins (IVIg) due to multifocal motor neuropathy (MMN)
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: A 71-year-old man with a 12-year history of asymmetric, relapsing-remitting, purely motor weakness of the left arm and right leg; symptoms developed over time, with intervals of IVIg administration shortening despite treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: anti-GM1antibody-negative multifocal motor neuropathy with a history of intermittent treatment using IVIg, cyclophosphamide, and interferon.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lives at home, is able to walk approximately 500 m with an aid, drives a car, and participates in social activities, only requiring assistance for showering and dressing.
